text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with Bananas Foster that's right
this amazing recipe was invented in
Brennan's restaurant in New Orleans and
named after a mr. Richard Foster who
apparently was a friend of the owners
and you know what I'm gonna need to do a
little research to find out if this guy
went by Richard or some other
alternative because if so this could be
the greatest inside joke in the history
of desserts and unlike many special
occasion desserts this one's actually
very simple and very fast to make so
let's go ahead and get started and this
is one of those recipes where you want
to get everything ready ahead of time
because it really does come together
quick so for this we're going to need
some butter and some brown sugar and
then of course something to measure
liqueur with since this is a dessert
that was invented in New Orleans you
know there's going to be booze in it and
we're going to use two kinds some banana
liqueur and some rum and you can use
dark rum or white Rama as you can see I
prefer the white and that's pretty much
it except for of course the bananas and
for this you're going to want to give
one banana per person and this is going
to be very simple to prep we're just
going to cut off both ends of course
we're going to take the peel off and
then all you need to do is cut it in
half and then cut each half a lengthwise
and that's pretty much it and by the way
these bananas were a little small we
don't want these cooking too fast and
falling apart in the pan so I do
generally prefer something with a little
more girth but anyway we're going to cut
up those bananas at that point we can
head over to the stove and start the fun
so we'll go ahead and we'll toss our
butter into a heavy bottomed skillet
along with our brown sugar and we'll set
that over medium-high heat and we'll
wait for that butter to melt and for
that mixture to start bubbling so give
it a couple minutes give it a little
stir every so often or of course the old
shake-a shake-a and in just a little
while it should get kind of bubbly and
basically look like that and when it
gets to that point we're going to go
ahead and place in our bananas flat side
down and of course do that carefully
this is not a mixture you want to be
splashing on your fingers and I should
mention is you're putting these bananas
into the pan do not worry if the mixture
looks a little grainy looks a little
separated that's totally normal
that's all going to dissolve and turn
into a beautiful sauce as soon as we add
our liquor in a rum and once we've
transferred our bananas into that brown
sugar butter mixture we're going to cook
that side but not very long only about
30 seconds one of the biggest mistakes
people make with Bananas Foster is
cooking the
is too long okay we want a very soft and
tender but we want them to keep their
shape so we're only given this side
about 30 seconds that's all it's going
to take to give it a little bit of color
at which point we'll flip them over if
for this I like to use a spoon and a
fork just flip them over like that and
then once those are all flipped over
we'll give that side another 30 seconds
to a minute
at which point we're going to add the
booze but before you do that one big tip
turn the flame off unless you're not big
on keeping your eyebrows you definitely
want to turn down or off the flame here
so we'll turn that off and we will dump
in our banana liqueur and our white rum
and then what's going to happen here
we're gonna put our heat back on a
medium-high you could probably even go
high heat at this point and as soon as
that alcohol warms up a little bit it
will ignite and you will have what's
called a flambe and if you're on a gas
stove all you need to do is kind of move
the pan over a little bit just tip it
ever so slightly and voila you should
have flames and once our pan has been
successfully set on fire it's time for
what I think is the most exciting part
the throwing in of the cinnamon and as
you'll see here when it hits the flames
it kind of sparkles check it out let me
do one more bigger pinch oh yeah
that's some serious Harry Potter stuff
right there okay so definitely do that
if people are watching if no one's
watching it doesn't matter you could
just sprinkle the cinnamon in at any
point but it is kind of a cool effect
and as soon as those flames die out
meaning the alcohol has burned off
you're ready to serve so let's remove
that from the heat and quickly and
carefully serve that over some vanilla
ice cream which as you can see is
already melting in my warm kitchen but
that's okay and we'll place 1 bananas
worth around the ice cream and come on
how amazing does that look now
withstanding a couple small drips of

the point is clean the drips and then
last but not least I'm gonna garnish
with a little sprig of mint chocolate

oh yeah there's such a thing and that
